content:
• Thursday, August 18, 2016
  • VIA

    Reports: Viacom OKs settlement with Redstone; CEO/Chairman Dauman to exit

    • The board of Viacom (VIA -2%, VIAB -2.1%) has approved a settlement with Sumner Redstone, according to media reports -- bringing to a close a legal fight that began to sprawl in courtrooms in Massachusetts, Delaware and California, and which pitted Redstone and daughter Shari against Sumner's onetime allies at the media giant.
    • The reported terms look like a win for Redstone. Viacom CEO and Chairman Philippe Dauman will exit as part of the deal.
    • Dauman's exit package is reportedly worth about $72M. As expected with such an outcome, Viacom veteran COO Tom Dooley will become interim CEO through September; Thomas May will become chairman.
    • National Amusements would name five new directors to the board as it had previously proposed in June.
    • Dauman and ally George Abrams would drop their Massachusetts suit, where they were seeking reinstatement to the National Amusements board and to Redstone's trust.
    • Dauman would still be executive chairman of the company until Sept. 13 and would likely present a proposal to the board to sell 49% of Paramount Pictures -- a move that is likely to fail amid Redstone's opposition, considering bylaws that call for unanimous board approval.
    • VIAB finished the after-hours session up 1%.
    • Previously: Reuters: Viacom board to meet tonight to consider Redstone settlement (Aug. 18 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 PM | 3 Comments
  • MBT

    Mobile Telesystems slips 3.6% as competition presses earnings

    • Mobile Telesystems (NYSE:MBT) fell 3.6% today after it posted Q2 earnings that were slightly weaker than expected amid tough competition.
    • OIBDA fell 4.3% to 40.89B rubles (OIBDA margin of almost 38%), while group revenue rose 5.3% to 108.1B rubles amid "strong retail sales; stable service revenue despite ongoing weaker usage in certain mobile market segments; growth in B2C home Internet and pay-TV markets; and growth in Ukraine through the steady adoption of 3G data services."
    • Competition has a "sustained impact" on effective pricing, said CEO Andrei Dubovskov, and combined with macroeconomic volatility dampened results.
    • Fixed-line revenues fell 2.8% to 15.3B rubles, while total revenue in Russia rose 3.3% to 97.4B rubles (90% of total).
    • Free cash flow was 24B rubles to date, up 22% Y/Y. Capex came to almost 40B rubles.
    • For 2016, it now sees revenue at 2-3% growth, and expects OIBDA to fall 4% mainly due to the sale of UMS. Group capex is affirmed at 85B rubles.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 PM
  • MSGN

    MSG Networks gets 5.8% boost after earnings beat

    • MSG Networks (NYSE:MSGN) rose 5.8% today after posting earnings that beat expectations on top and bottom lines
    • Income from continuing operations was $43.2M, down fractionally Y/Y, while revenue grew 4.8% to $160.5M/
    • Net income grew 6.7% to $48.7M. Adjusted operating cash flow rose 30.6% to $79.8M.
    • Affiliation fee revenue rose $7.3M on higher rates; ad revenue inched up $0.4M, with the help of higher average per-game sales on live sports.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 PM
  • VIA

    Reuters: Viacom board to meet tonight to consider Redstone settlement

    • The board of Viacom (VIA -2%, VIAB -2.1%) is meeting tonight to discuss a settlement with Sumner Redstone, the 93-year-old mogul who holds voting power at the company, Reuters reports.
    • Such a settlement would include the exit of company CEO Philippe Dauman and might start to bring peace to what has been an acrimonious battle between former close friends Redstone and Dauman over the company -- more particularly, Dauman's removal from the board of National Amusements, Redstone's holding company, and the trust that will eventually manage Redstone's assets.
    • National Amusements holds 80% of voting power at Viacom and at CBS.
    • After hours: VIAB +1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 1 Comment

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: NWY +31.2%. CXW +29.4%. CPSI +19.6%. AMAT +5.6%. MENT +5.0%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: FXCM -9.5%. DBVT -2.5%. ESV -2.1%. MT -2.1%. ARRY -1.7%.

  • CNET

    ChinaNet Online sets 1-for-2.5 reverse split for tomorrow

    • ChinaNet Online Holdings (CNET +1.7%) has announced a 1-for-2.5 reverse split of its common stock.
    • The move -- intended to boost share price to meet Nasdaq's $1.00 minimum bid requirement -- is effective with the commencement of trading tomorrow. Shares had last traded for $1.00 in summer 2015.
    • The action reduces the number of shares of common stock outstanding to about 12.2M form the previous 30.4M. Fractional shares will be rounded up to a full share.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • ROST

    Ross Stores higher after cruising past estimates

    • Operating margin rose 50 bps to 14.4% of sales at Ross Stores (ROST +0.9%) in Q2 with higher merchandise margins in play.
    • Merchandise inventory: +3.4% Y/y to $1.5602B.
    • Store count: +77 Y/Y to 1,501.
    • The company sees full-year EPS of $2.69 to $2.75 vs. $2.71 consensus.
    • Previously: Ross Stores beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (Aug. 18)
    • ROST +1.81% AH to $64.10.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • CXW

    Corrections Corp responds to DOJ decision; up 23% after hours

    • "It’s important to note that today’s announcement relates only to Bureau of Prisons correctional facilities, which make up 7% of our business," says Correction Corp. of America (NYSE:CXW) in a note sent to StreetInsider.
    • The IG report used to buttress the DOJ's decision to end private prisons for the BOP has "significant flaws," says the company. "The findings simply don’t match up to the numerous independent studies that show our facilities to be equal or better with regard to safety and quality, or the excellent feedback we get from our partners at all levels of government."
    • After falling 46.9% in the regular session, the stock's higher by 23% in busy after hours action. GEO Group up 0.7% after hours following a 39.6% regular session decline.
    • Previously: Prison stocks defended at Canaccord (Aug. 18)
    • Previously: DOJ to end use of private prisons - Corrections Corp, GEO Group crumble (Aug. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 40 Comments
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials posts record Q3 EPS, projects strong Q4; shares +6%

    • Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) delivered record EPS of $0.50 and all-time highs in new orders ($3.66B) and backlog ($4.95B).
    • President and CEO Gary Dickerson: "With earnings and orders at an all-time high, Applied is performing better than ever and in a great position to sustainably outperform our markets. We are in the early stages of large, multi-year industry inflections that are driving our business today and creating new opportunities for future growth."
    • Projects Q4 net sales to grow 15%-10% sequentially and adjusted diluted EPS of $0.61-$0.69.
    • Conference call
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 5 Comments
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials beats by $0.02, misses on revenue

    • Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT): FQ3 EPS of $0.50 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $2.82B (+13.3% Y/Y) misses by $20M.
    • Shares +2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • ROST

    Ross Stores beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST): Q2 EPS of $0.71 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $3.2B (+7.7% Y/Y) beats by $70M.
    • Shares +1.8%.

  • PLAB

    Photronics -10% following announcement of $160M China investment, tepid quarter

    • The company posted lower-than-expected Q3 numbers this morning along with plans it would expand IC manufacturing in China over a five-year period.
    • The company intends to build a facility in Xiamen, China, signing an agreement in exchange for specific considerations and subsidies from The Administrative Committee of Xiamen Torch Hi-Tech Industrial Development Zone.
    • Photronics (PLAB -10.4%) will construct and operate the facility, with production slated to begin in 2018. Transferred capital and cash with the option of local financing are being employed to fund the project.
    • Earnings call transcript
    • Earnings slides
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • IEP

    Icahn Enterprises downgraded at UBS; down 6.4%

    • Persistent pressure on the company's operating segment combined with poor results at Icahn's hedge fund mean nearly 50% risk in the stock, says analyst Brennan Hawken, downgrading Icahn Enterprises (IEP -6.4%) to Sell from Neutral.
    • The company owns a $1.8B stake in an investment fund run by Icahn with stakes in Cheniere Energy, Freeport McMoRan, AIG, and PayPal, but the fund is also net short 149%. The investment portfolio fell 6% in Q2 thanks to the short interest, marking the fourth straight quarter of a loss greater than 5%.
    • With markets nicely ahead since the end of June, Q3 could prove to be another three months.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 33 Comments
  • GEO

    Prison stocks defended at Canaccord

    • The DOJ's plans to end the use of private prisons is no doubt bad news for the names, say analysts Ryan Meliker and Michael Kodesch, but near-50% intraday declines (now moderated somewhat) seem like overkill.
    • For GEO Group (GEO -38.8%), the stock is trading at close to 20% of free cash flow, and Corrections Corp (CXW -37.3%) at nearly 15%.
    • The team notes GEO has just 11% exposure to federal prisons, while CXW has 9%, so the massive declines imply the risk will spread to other jurisdictions. "While this is possible, we believe it is unlikely."
    • Previously: DOJ to end use of private prisons - Corrections Corp, GEO Group crumble (Aug. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 40 Comments

  • TELNY

    Telenor still working on complicated exit from VimpelCom

    • Telenor (OTCPK:TELNY +1.9%) is still working out how to divest a $2.5B stake in VimpelCom (VIP +0.7%), a move it planned last October amid multiple government probes into bribery at VimpelCom.
    • But a key problem is that the only other obvious buyer is Mikhail Fridman and his LetterOne, with whom Telenor has been in open conflict over control of VimpelCom.
    • "We have hired financial advisers that are helping us to plan how our exit will happen but we don't know what the structure will look like. We are in a planning phase," says Telenor CEO Sigve Brekke.
    • Telenor lost its chairman last fall as part of the VimpelCom fallout, and the company cut ties with its ex-CEO, who had been working as a consultant.
    • VimpelCom agreed to a $795M settlement of a U.S. and Dutch probe over its dealings in Uzbekistan.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: LLEX +32%. CIE +27%. CRK +21%. SGY +14%. AREX +11%.
    • Losers: BCEI -19%. OTC:JONE -15%. MBII -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • WMB

    Williams Cos. up nearly 7% on report of Enterprise Products attention

    • Williams Cos. (NYSE:WMB) has jumped (as much as 11.6% minutes ago) on a report that Enterprise Product Partners (NYSE:EPD) approached it this summer with an acquisition.
    • Williams shares have fallen back to just a 6.6% gain. EPD spiked briefly and has now headed for negative territory, -0.2%.
    • Williams didn't make an official response, Reuters says, since its recent gains meant Enterprise's offer carried little to no premium.
    • Despite that, Enterprise remains interested in a deal that would create an $80B giant, the Financial Times reports.
    • A planned merger of Williams with Energy Transfer Equity fell apart in June as ETE walked away after a favorable court ruling.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 59 Comments
  • TGT

    Target back below $70 after getting lapped by peers

    • The gap between Target (TGT -0.9%) and its major rivals widened today after Wal-Mart reported solid Q2 sales growth.
    • Shares of Target are now down 3.6% YTD, compared to the +20% run for Wal-Mart and 13% rise for Amazon. Perhaps even harder to digest for investors, Target also trails broad retail ETFs for the year.
    • Several retail sector analysts have pointed to Target's stumbles with its grocery business as a drag on earnings.
    • Target is back below $70 for the first time since early July.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 34 Comments
  • SEMI

    SunEdison Semiconductor +38% after agreeing to be bought out by GlobalWafers in $683M deal

    • The companies announced the $12 per-share buyout yesterday evening (a 45% premium over the day's closing price).
    • The arrangement was unanimously approved by both companies' board of directors.
    • SunEdison Semiconductor (SEMI +38.5%) CEO Shaker Sadasivam: "We believe this transaction is in the best interest of our company.  We look forward to a smooth process to facilitate an efficient closing, which we hope can occur before the end of the year."
    • Johnson & Weaver, LLP, a shareholder rights law firm based in San Diego, has subsequently launched an investigation into the price of the transaction.
    • SunEdison Semiconductor is up more than 155% over the last three months.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM

  • Oil prices up more than 20% in two weeks

    • WTI crude oil is higher by 2.8% today to $48.09 per barrel, putting the price of black gold nearly 22% above the $39.51 it touched on August 2.
    • Chatter about some some of production freeze out of OPEC make for a good excuse, but Iran's plans to raise its output back up to pre-sanction levels calls that into question.
    • Also helping the bulls: Hurricane season is on the way and the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration recently boosted its expectations for storm activity.
    • USO +2.6%
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UWTI, UCO, DWTI, SCO, BNO, DBO, DTO, UGA, USL, DNO, OLO, UHN, SZO, OLEM, OILD, OILX, OILU
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 31 Comments
  • EIHDF

    888 Holdings and Rank Group give up on William Hill pursuit

    • 888 Holdings (OTCPK:EIHDF) and Rank Group (OTCPK:RANKF) have thrown in the towel on their acquisition bid for William Hill (OTCPK:WIMHF) after being rebuffed twice.
    • "We believe that there was compelling industrial logic for the combination of these highly complementary businesses," stated 888 CEO Itai Frieberger.
    • Shares of William Hill fell 1.53% in London trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 1 Comment

  • WUBA

    58.com down 14% despite 87% revenue increase, 'regained profitability'

    • Revenue in 58.com's (WUBA -14.5%) Q2 grew to $298.8M, in line with company guidance of $296M-$303M, though below what analysts were expecting. The company is additionally projecting Q3 revenue of $304M-$311M (+52%-56% Y/Y), below the consensus of $343M.

  • CXW

    DOJ to end use of private prisons - Corrections Corp, GEO Group crumble

    • Concluding the facilities are both less safe and less effective at providing correction services than those run by the government, the government plans to end its use of private prisons.
    • In a memo today, Deputy Attorney General Sally Yates instructs officials to either decline or renew contracts for private prison operators, or "substantially reduce" the contracts' scope.
    • Corrections Corporation of America (CXW -9.6%), The GEO Group (GEO -15.1%).
    • Update at 12:13: Reopened for trade, both names are now down 40% on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 146 Comments

  • VRS

    Verso sells off as confidence fades

    • Verso Corporation (NYSE:VRS) continues to get punished after reporting soft Q2 numbers earlier this week,
    • Shares are down 12% on the day and 41% for the week.
    • The company emerged from bankruptcy earlier this summer to a paper market facing some demand issues.
    • Previously: Verso reports Q2 results (Aug. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • BONT

    More on Bon-Ton Stores' Q2

    • The Bon-Ton Stores (OTC:BONT -3.7%) reports comparable-store sales declined 2% in Q2.
    • Proprietary credit card sales rate increased 390 bps to 57.1%.
    • The company saw sales growth in Activewear, Big & Tall, Denim, Young Men’s, Young Contemporary Plus, Women’s Better Handbags, Hard Home and Furniture.
    • Gross margin rate squeezed 30 bps to 36.5%.
    • SG&A expense rate leveraged 40 bps to 38.2%.
    • Adjusted EBITDA fell 57% to $2.47M.
    • Merchandise inventories -6% to $693.81M.
    • Store count -3 Y/Y to 267.
    • The company ended the quarter with excess borrowing capacity of $225M under its revolving credit facility.
    • FY2016 Guidance: Adjusted EBITDA: $130M to $140M; Net loss: $29M to $19M; Diluted EPS: -$0.95 to -$1.45.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • RTW

    New York & Company rallies in front of earnings

    • New York & Company (NWY +7.1%) spikes in front of the company's Q2 earnings report which is due out after the bell today.
    • A strong report from L Brands may be giving some investors confidence along with whisper numbers leaning to the positive side.
    • Shares of NWY are back over $2 for the first time in almost three months.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • PERY

    Perry Ellis lower after disclosing store closing plan

    • Perry Ellis International (PERY -9.3%) after recording another loss in Q2.
    • EBITDA as a percentage of sales fell 70 bps to 3.5% during the quarter as higher SG&A expenses took a toll.
    • The company says it will close 15 stores over the next 18 months in an effort to boost profitability.
    • Previously: Perry Ellis beats by $0.14, beats on revenue (Aug. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • ILMN

    Thermo Fisher rumored to make $30B bid for Illumina

    • Illumina (ILMN +0.7%) has reportedly received a $30B offer from Thermo Fisher Scientific (TMO -0.9%).
    • Illumina, sporting a $25B market cap, is a global leader in molecular diagnostic systems. In Q2 it earned $0.82 a share on revenues of $600M.
    • Large cap ($61B) Thermo is a global leader in clinical diagnostics that generates ~$17B a year in sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 21 Comments
  • NFEC

    NF Energy surges on new business

    • NF Energy (NFEC +15.1%) announces the inking of $600K of sales contracts with four Chinese companies.
    • The total order includes electric butterfly valves and hydraulic control butterfly valves with DN400-DN2800. All products are expected to be delivered between September and October of this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • NTAP

    NetApp +9%; Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley remain cautious

    • NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) posted a better-than-expected Q1, though Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley are maintaining respective Sell and Underweight ratings on the company.
    • Goldman Sachs analyst Simona Jankowski cites strong price pressure in the storage market while Morgan Stanley analyst Katy Huberty attributes the results to U.S. public sector growth skewing ONTAP 7 refreshes and "better performance in the quarter at OEM customers," something she doesn't expect to continue.
    • Jankowski and Huberty raise their price targets from $23 to $26 and $21 to $24, respectively.
    • J.P. Morgan and Susquehanna have issued more positive outlooks following the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM | 4 Comments

    Eiger Bio prices equity offering; shares down 8% premarket

    • Eiger BioPharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:EIGR) slumps 8% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement that it has priced its public offering of 1.25M shares of common stock at $16. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 187.5K shares. Closing date is August 23.
    • Net proceeds will fund clinical development, working capital and general corporate purposes.
    • Yesterday's close was $17.19.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM

    Kinder Morgan perks up after Morgan Stanley upgrade

    • Morgan Stanley upgrades Kinder Morgan (NYSE:KMI) to Overweight after having the energy infrastructure stock set at Equalweight.
    • The investment firm assigns a price target of $24 on shares.
    • KMI +2.02% premarket to $22.19 vs. a 52-week trading range of $11.20 to $33.98.

    Karyopharm up 7% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap Karyopharm Therapeutics (NASDAQ:KPTI) is up 7% premarket, albeit on only 5,650 shares. H.C. Wainwright initiated coverage with a Buy (what else) recommendation and $15 (100% upside) price target.

  • OMED

    OncoMed prices equity offering; shares down 15% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap OncoMed Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:OMED) slumps 15% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement that it has priced its public offering of 5.5M shares of common stock at $10. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 825K shares. Closing date is August 23. Net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes.
    • Yesterday's close was $11.71.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • RPTP

    Raptor Pharmaceuticals in play; shares up 16% premarket

    • Raptor Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RPTP) is ahead 16% premarket on robust volume on the buzz that several companies are eyeing the Novato, CA firm, including Shire plc (NASDAQ:SHPG) who alleged has already bid $800M and Retrophin (NASDAQ:RTRX), founded by biotech bad boy Martin Shkreli.
    • Raptor focuses its development efforts in rare diseases. Its pipeline includes programs in Huntington's disease, cancer, cystic fibrosis and mitochondrial diseases.
    • It currently markets two products: PROCYSBI (cysteamine bitartrate) delayed-release capsules for nephropathic cystinosis and QUINSAIR (aerosolized form of levofloxacin) for the management of chronic pulmonary infections.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM | 2 Comments
  • BLDP

    Ballard, Toyota Tsusho sign distribution agreement

    • Ballard Power (NASDAQ:BLDP) +7.6% premarket after signing a distribution agreement with Toyota Tsusho Corp., a member company of the Toyota Group.
    • Under the agreement, TTC will act as a distributor of Ballard-powered fuel cell products in Japan. The initial term of the agreement runs to December 31, 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM | 16 Comments
  • BHC

    Valeant nabs lender OK for credit facility changes; shares up 5% premarket

    • Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) is up 5% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement that it has obtained lender approval to amend its credit facility.
    • The amendment will reduce the coverage maintenance covenant to 2.0x, provide more flexibility to sell assets, permit the issuance of secured notes with shorter maturities to repay term loans and permit it to incur other debt to repay term loans.
    • The company has agreed to increase each of the applicable interest rate margins on its credit facility by 0.50% and to pay an amendment fee equal to 0.25% of the aggregate principal amount of each consenting lender's outstanding loans and commitments under the credit facility.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM | 127 Comments
  • SSI

    More on Stage Stores' Q2

    • Stage Stores (NYSE:SSI) reports comparable-store sales declined 9.8% in Q2.
    • Gross margin rate dropped 50 bps to 25.3%.
    • SG&A expense rate rose 20 bps to 25.2%.
    • Merchandise inventories -.5.9% to $461.12M.
    • Store count -4 Q/Q to 821.
    • FY2016 Guidance:Sales: $1.53B to $1.56B; Comparable-store sales: -6% to -4%; Adjusted EPS: $0.20 to $0.40; Weighted average diluted shares: 28.2M; Capex: ~$65M.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM | 2 Comments

    Insider buys spark Cobalt Energy

    • CEO Timothy Cutt purchased 100K shares at about $1 each on Tuesday, and CFO David Powell 100K shares at about $0.985.
    • CIE +28.6% premarket to $1.35.

    L Brands on the move after posting solid Q2 numbers

    • L Brands (NYSE:LB) is higher after reporting a 3% increase in same-store sales in Q2.
    • Same-store sales rose 2% at Victoria's Secret to improve on the 1% mark in Q1.
    • L Brands increased full-year EPS guidance to $3.70-$3.85 vs. $3.60-$3.80 prior and $3.73 consensus.

    Cardinal Financial halted; sale announcement expected

    • According to a leak yesterday, a sale of Cardinal Financial (NASDAQ:CFNL) to United Bankshares (NASDAQ:UBSI) was in the works.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar on the move after blowing through estimates

    • Q2  net income of $40.4M or $0.68 per share compared to $22.6M and $0.39 in Q1. Street estimates for Q2 were for just $0.37. Revenue of $805.9M compared to $721.4M in Q1, and company guidance of $710M-$760M.

  • EARS

    Auris Medical's lead product candidate flunks late-stage study; shares plummet 42% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap Auris Medical (NASDAQ:EARS) craters 42% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement that its Phase 3 clinical trial, TACTT2, assessing lead product candidate Keyzilen (AM-101) for the treatment of acute tinnitus (ringing in the ear) failed to beat placebo in both co-primary endpoints.
    • TACTT2 randomized 343 patients to receive either Keyzilen or placebo in a 3:2 ratio. The co-primary endpoints were the improvement in subjective tinnitus loudness from baseline to Day 84 and the improvement in tinnitus burden from baseline to Day 84 as measured by the Tinnitus Functional Index (TFI).
    • Data from the second Phase 3, TACTT3, will be available in Q4. Its primary endpoint is the change in tinnitus loudness at Day 84. The change in TFI is a secondary endpoint.
    • CEO Thomas Meyer says, "We are disappointed that our TACTT2 trial did not reach its co-primary efficacy endpoints. The assessment of the trial data in ongoing and we intend to discuss outcomes and our plans for a path forward with regulatory agencies prior to the readout from the TACTT3 trial."
    • AM-101 contains esketamine hydrochloride, an N-Methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) receptor antagonist. It is administered in one treatment cycle consisting of three injections into the middle ear over three to five days. Once injected, the drug diffuses through the round window into the cochlea.
    • Management will host a conference call this morning at 8:00 am ET to discuss the data.

  • JNP

    Juniper Pharma's lidocaine bioadhesive gel flunks mid-stage study, development terminated; shares down 15% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Juniper Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JNP) is down 15% premarket, albeit on only 600 shares, in response to its announcement that a Phase 2b clinical trial assessing COL-1077, an investigational 10% lidocaine bioadhesive gel, for the reduction in pain intensity in women undergoing an endometrial biopsy with tenaculum (surgical clamp) placement, failed to meet its primary and secondary endpoints.
    • CEO Alicia Secor says, "Based on the results of this trial, we are discontinuing development of COL-1077. We will focus Juniper's resources on our differentiated intravaginal ring technology to advance our pipeline of product candidates to address unmet needs in women's health."

  • PTLA

    FDA rejects Portola's AndexXa BLA; shares down 18% premarket

    • Portola Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PTLA) plummets 18% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement that it received a Complete Response Letter (CRL) from the FDA regarding its Biologics License Application (BLA) seeking approval of anticoagulant reversal agent AndexXa (andexanet alfa).
    • The company says most of the requested information relates to manufacturing although the agency also wants more data to support inclusion of edoxaban [Daiichi Sankyo's (OTCPK:DSKYF)(OTCPK:DSNKY) Savaysa] and enoxaparin [Sanofi's (NASDAQ:SNY) LOVENOX] in the label. It also stated that it needs more time to complete its review of the clinical amendments to Portola's post-marketing commitments that were submitted recently.
    • Andexanet alfa is a modified human Factor Xa molecule that acts as a decoy to target and sequester, with high specificity, Factor Xa inhibitors in the blood. Once bound, the Factor Xa inhibitors are unable to inhibit Factor Xa and normal hemostatic processes are restored.
    • Management will host a conference call this morning at 8:30 am ET to discuss the situation.
    • Previously: Portola down 10% ahead of FDA action on AndexXa (Aug. 17)
